Moral Beauty of Testing Truth--As you are to begin work in a new mission, be careful that your 
                                                                           329
defects are not exalted as virtues, and thus retard the work of God. It is testing truths that we are bringing before the people, and in every movement these truths should be elevated to stand in moral beauty before those for whom we labor. Do not throw about the truth the peculiarities of your own character, or your own manner of labor.--Lt 12, 1887.
